main_definition: Days refers to the time period between sunrise and sunset, as well as being used in idioms or expressions to represent different meanings such as duration of events.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Time from one day to another
meanings_and_examples.example: I will visit you two days later.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A period or length of time, especially in the context of a specific event or experience
meanings_and_examples.example: The training camp lasted for three days.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In idioms and expressions to represent various meanings such as 'days gone by' (the past) or 'to go through days' (to endure hardships)
meanings_and_examples.example: Looking back at the days gone by, I wish we had spent more time together.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Time from one day to another
meanings_and_examples.example: I will visit you two days later.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A period or length of time, especially in the context of a specific event or experience
meanings_and_examples.example: The training camp lasted for three days.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In idioms and expressions to represent various meanings such as 'days gone by' (the past) or 'to go through days' (to endure hardships)
meanings_and_examples.example: Looking back at the days gone by, I wish we had spent more time together.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to represent a long duration of time in some contexts
meanings_and_examples.example: They lived happily ever after for many days.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to the Earth's rotation and its cycle from sunrise to sunset
meanings_and_examples.example: The day had been long, with plenty of work to do before nightfall.
